"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"In summary, unroll the cone to get a flat, circular sector. Its radius is 60, but the circular sector's circumference is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"40 \pi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore the central angle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta = \frac{40 \pi}{60} = 120º"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Now place A on one vertex, and B on the other vertex 10 units up, so the other side is 50 units. The length of AB is therefore "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10 \sqrt{91}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" using the cosine rule. The downhill portion of this line is the shorter part intersected by the perpendicular bisector. Now using the Pythagorean theorem, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"60^2 - (10\sqrt{91}-x)^2 = 50^2 - x = h^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the length of the downhill portion and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"h"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the altitude. The "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" terms cancel, leaving a linear equation which gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = \frac{400}{\sqrt91}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"
